message: E10, Chronicles of KGP: "Reveling the Past"

Over the years, Students' Alumni Cell has grown from an infant into what it is today. Prof Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay, as the Dean of Alumni Affairs an International relations has always been supportive and helped take the cell to new heights. He has now passed on the baton to Prof Baidurya Bhattacharya and the Students' Alumni Cell takes immense pleasure in welcoming him and looks forward to adding more feathers to the cap of Alumni Cell under his guidance.
story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.

Ambulance target reached! :D

Thanks once again to the tremendous generosity of our alumni, our ambulance target of $35,000 has been achieved!

Further money raised will go towards the student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services). Our goal is to reach $60,000.

A huge thanks to IITKGP Foundation for taking this initiative for the students.

Once again in tough times, the true spirit of KGP has emerged forth uniting the entire KGP family as a whole. 

#for_a_better_kgp
#every_help_counts

The Student-Alumni Meet, Hyderabad was conducted in full fervour on 23rd December. It observed an enthusiastic participation from the alumni and students alike. We would like to especially thank Hyderabad Chapter for their great support.
Stay connected with the page to know more about upcoming Student Alumni Meets and other programs.

message: Students' Alumni Cell wishes you a Merry Christmas and may this festival bring abundant joy and happiness in your life!
Students' Alumni Cell wishes you a Merry Christmas and may this festival bring abundant joy and happiness in your life!

If you get a chance to choose your life again, will you do it differently? What is your purpose in life? “Many Dreams Many Lives”, a book written by our alumna Ms Viji Narayanan (Batch of 1991) follows an Indian women in America who’s emotionally charged self journey begs us to ask these same question over and over again. Cultural discord, marriage, relationship issues with in-laws, world view from different societies, mental health everything is covered in this book. The book will be available on Amazon bookstore in all countries from 11th January 2018 as a paperback print and digital download from Kindle. 
Ms. Viji Narayanan graduated from the Architecture Department, IIT Kharagpur in 1991, is a software engineer and an emerging author with a love for a good story. She is also a  bollywood buff who aspires to make this unique and compelling book into a Bollywood movie one day.
Watch this Book trailer on Youtube to know more about “Many Dreams Many Lives” - https://youtu.be/UXyqPOtCHqE

Vacations and festivals have always been fun. To make this Winter Break more exciting and worthwhile, we bring to you the much anticipated Student Alumni Meet, Hyderabad edition. Employ the treasured counsel of our knowledgeable and experienced Alumni at SAM Hyderabad for which the student registrations are now open! Register yourself to be a part of fun and cognitive interaction with our Alumni based in Hyderabad.

Register now by navigating to https://tinyurl.com/sam-hyderabad-2017

Date : 23rd December
Time: 11 am to 3 pm 
Venue : Railway Officers' Club, Mettuguda

Days seem so slow and stagnant and we just can’t wait for the BIG days to knock on our doors, but when they finally arrive, they pass as if in a snap of our fingers everything we've been preparing for has already happened. The three days we have been waiting for, pass by as if in a flash, so fast that we can't believe our very eyes. So let us all savour the waiting and the craving. 
With just 25 days to go, we are all geared up to bring you the most enthralling 3 days of January. We are leaving no opportunity, to maximize this experience for you. Let's all take a Journey Back Home and unlock wonderful memories together!

PS- That's KGP from air around 30 years back! :D
